Carolyn Grace

Posted on November 2, 2020 by webdevral

Ms. Grace has been a resident of Gloucester Township since 1987. She moved to the area with the goals of raising her three daughters in a community that embodied her own values: family, love for your neighbor, importance of education, hard work, and being of service to others.

Ms. Grace earned her Master’s in Social Work from Rutgers University and a Master’s in School Leadership from Wilmington University. She holds valid certifications as a School Social Worker, Teacher of Psychology, and School Principal. Ms. Grace has spent most of her career as a member on the Child Study Team and a school administration in local school districts.

In 2016, Ms. Grace co-founded The Brittany Woods Community Action Group (BWCAG), which collaborates with multiple departments in Gloucester Township government to complete community enhancement projects – all for the betterment of the community.

Ms. Grace has been honored with various community and governmental service awards. In 2018, Ms. Grace was elected and served as a member of the Gloucester Township School Board. She is a member of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Incorporated and whole heartily believes

“A Vision for Change” requires community service, political activism, a voice for the underserved, and grassroots ACTION!

‹ David Carlamere
James Nash ›
